channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The House passed a budget resolution. What's next? And, a tactic to decrease bird flu
item.description: House Republicans rallied together yesterday to pass multitrillion-dollar plan to address defense, immigration and more. And, why farmers don't like the idea of vaccinating poultry for bird flu.
item.content:encoded:
House Republicans rallied together yesterday to pass multitrillion-dollar plan to address defense, immigration and more. And, why farmers don't like the idea of vaccinating poultry for bird flu.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Israelis hold a mass funeral for Shiri Bibas and her two sons killed in Gaza
item.description: Crowds gathered in Israel for the funeral procession of the Bibas family, a mother and two young sons killed while being held hostage in Gaza. The story of their killing has enraged Israelis, and Israeli government representatives were not invited to the funeral.
item.content:encoded:
Crowds gathered in Israel for the funeral procession of the Bibas family, a mother and two young sons killed while being held hostage in Gaza. The story of their killing has enraged Israelis, and Israeli government representatives were not invited to the funeral.

(Image credit: Ariel Schalit)
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: For Women's History Month, NPR wants to know who has made an impact in your life
item.description: Is there a woman who has impacted your life in a profound way? NPR wants to hear your story.
item.content:encoded:
Is there a woman who has impacted your life in a profound way? NPR wants to hear your story.

(Image credit: Kevin Winter)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: Tablets for tots? Survey says kids watch videos on their own devices by age 2
item.description: A.I. is the other big change in the media landscape for kids and parents, the report from Common Sense Media finds.
item.content:encoded:
A.I. is the other big change in the media landscape for kids and parents, the report from Common Sense Media finds.

(Image credit: Riccardo Milani)
item.dc:creator: Katia Riddle

item.title: Lunar Trailblazer sets out to find water on the moon
item.description: The Lunar Trailblazer orbiter's launch window opens Feb 26. It's catching a ride with Intuitive Machines IM-2 mission which is landing on the moon near the south pole. Both have instruments for looking for water.
item.content:encoded:
The Lunar Trailblazer orbiter's launch window opens Feb 26. It's catching a ride with Intuitive Machines IM-2 mission which is landing on the moon near the south pole. Both have instruments for looking for water.

(Image credit: NASA JPL / Lockheed Martin Space)
item.dc:creator: Joe Palca

item.title: How 'Anora' breakout star Yura Borisov crafted a sensitive 'brute'
item.description: Borisov, who plays the hired henchman Igor in Anora, is the first Russian actor to be nominated for an Oscar in decades. The film has a total of six nominations, including for best picture.
item.content:encoded: Borisov, who plays the hired henchman Igor in Anora, is the first Russian actor to be nominated for an Oscar in decades. The film has a total of six nominations, including for best picture.
item.dc:creator: Mandalit del Barco

item.title: Trump White House seeks tighter grip on message with new limits on press
item.description: In the White House briefing room Tuesday, the Trump administration announced its latest steps to tighten its grip on the message it sends out and the news coverage it receives.
item.content:encoded:
In the White House briefing room Tuesday, the Trump administration announced its latest steps to tighten its grip on the message it sends out and the news coverage it receives.

(Image credit: Jim Watson)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Some Trump voters want him to rein in health care costs. It's unclear if he will
item.description: In polls and focus groups, Trump voters say they want the government to do something about big medical bills. It's a big change from 5 years ago, pollsters say, and may not be on Trump's agenda.
item.content:encoded:
In polls and focus groups, Trump voters say they want the government to do something about big medical bills. It's a big change from 5 years ago, pollsters say, and may not be on Trump's agenda.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Noam Levey

item.title: What if I'm missing a form? Attorneys answer tax questions from NPR's audience
item.description: We asked our listeners to send us their most befuddling questions about the 2025 tax season. What if you can't pay your tax bill? How good is online tax software? Two tax attorneys weigh in.
item.content:encoded:
We asked our listeners to send us their most befuddling questions about the 2025 tax season. What if you can't pay your tax bill? How good is online tax software? Two tax attorneys weigh in.

(Image credit: Amr Bo Shanab)
item.dc:creator: Marielle Segarra

item.title: Did an Alzheimer's drug give Sue and Ken Bell more time? Maybe
item.description: Sue Bell became one of the first Alzheimer's patients in the U.S. to receive the drug now marketed as Leqembi. Her husband isn't sure if it made a difference.
item.content:encoded:
Sue Bell became one of the first Alzheimer's patients in the U.S. to receive the drug now marketed as Leqembi. Her husband isn't sure if it made a difference.

(Image credit: Michael B. Thomas/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Jon Hamilton
